alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Grande Ronde Valley; John Day Basin; Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Ochoco-John Day Highlands; Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 27 at 11:35AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...HIGH STREAM AND RIVER LEVELS THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK... More showers and thunderstorms will produce moderate to heavy rain across portions of northeast Oregon and southeast Washington for the next few days. Rainfall amounts ranging from 1 inch to around 2.25 inches are expected in the eastern Oregon mountains and Blue Mountain Foothills through Monday. In the Washington Cascades, rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are anticipated. This will lead to continued high levels and additional rises on the rivers and streams across this area as well as ponding of water in low-lying area and fields. In steep terrain locations, there will also be a risk of small rock or mud slides. At this time, river rises will reach action stage in a few places but are not expected to reach flood stage. However, heavier than anticipated thunderstorm rain over the next few days could change these expectations. The heaviest precipitation is expected to occur Saturday night and Sunday with showers tapering off by Monday afternoon. it will take some time for all the water to reach streams and high water levels are expected to continue into the middle of next week before beginning to recede.
